Package camzup.core

Class MeshEntity3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Entity
camzup.core.Entity3
camzup.core.MeshEntity3
All Implemented Interfaces:
IBlenderWritable, IEntity, IOriented3, ISpatial3, IUtils, IVolume, IVolume3, Iterable<Mesh3>
Direct Known Subclasses:
ImageEntity3
public class MeshEntity3 extends Entity3 implements Iterable<Mesh3>, IVolume3, IBlenderWritable
An entity which contains a transform that is applied to a list of meshes.

    Modifier and Type

      public MeshEntity3 reframe()
      Centers and rescales all meshes in the entity about a shared origin by calculating their dimensions, subtracting the center point, and scaling by the maximum dimension.
      Returns:
      this mesh entity.

    • setCoord

      public MeshEntity3 setCoord(int meshIndex, int coordIndex, Vec3 global, Vec3 local)
      Sets a coordinate in a mesh. Multiplies the input coordinate in global space by the transform's inverse.

      To facilitate editing the mesh with a graphical user interface (GUI).
      Parameters:
      meshIndex - the mesh index
      coordIndex - the coordinate index
      global - the point in global space
      local - the point in mesh local space
      Returns:
      this entity

    • toBlenderCode

      public String toBlenderCode()
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 3.x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes.
      Returns:
      the string

    • toBlenderCode

      public String toBlenderCode(boolean useAutoSmooth, float autoAngle, MaterialSolid[] materials, float gamma, float metallic, float roughness, float specular, float clearcoat, float clearcoatRough)
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 2.8x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes, i.e., to compare how mesh geometry looks in Blender (the control) versus in the library (the test).
      Parameters:
      useAutoSmooth - auto smooth normals
      autoAngle - auto smooth angle
      materials - the materials
      gamma - color gamma adjustment
      metallic - metallic factor
      roughness - roughness factor
      specular - specular highlight strength
      clearcoat - clear coat factor
      clearcoatRough - clear coat roughness
      Returns:
      the string

    • toBlenderCode

      public String toBlenderCode(MaterialSolid[] ms)
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 2.8x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      ms - the materials
      Returns:
      the string

      public MeshEntity3 toOrigin()

      this mesh entity.
